intro: Pedicularis foliosa, commonly known as the leafy lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia and North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. Pedicularis foliosa is known for its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, making it an interesting subject for botanical study.
